qas.question: Where did land redistribution begin in 1979?
When did the Jefara plain land redistribution end?
What was the maximum amount of money a person could have in their bank account without having it expropriated in 1980?
As a result of the 1981 laws putting the government in control of commerce, what began to thrive?
What took the place of private businesses in 1981?

context: In 1979, the committees began the redistribution of land in the <a0_0>Jefara plain<a0_0/>, continuing through <a1_0>1981<a1_0/>. In May 1980, measures to redistribute and equalize wealth were implemented; anyone with over <a2_0>1000 dinar<a2_0/> in his bank account saw that extra money expropriated. The following year, the GPC announced that the government would take control of all import, export and distribution functions, with <a4_0>state supermarkets<a4_0/> replacing privately owned businesses; this led to a decline in the availability of consumer goods and the development of a thriving <a3_0>black market<a3_0/>.
